intro: Spergularia angolensis, commonly known as the Angolan sandspurry, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly Namibia and Angola, where it thrives in sandy and coastal environments. The plant is characterized by its small, pink or white flowers and succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in arid conditions. It typically grows close to the ground, forming dense mats that stabilize sand dunes. Spergularia angolensis is adapted to harsh, sun-exposed habitats and plays a role in preventing soil erosion in its native range.
